alert.note: Alert for Brooks (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 5:55PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Brooks County through 615 PM CDT... At 555 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Encino. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Brooks County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
